result.title: Report on emissions reduction potential under technological and dietary change
result.description: Detailed report as result of Task 4.5 on diet scenarios considering business as usual and alternative healthy diets will be provided. Data on emissions and energy associated with the different diet scenarios will be produced using outputs from D1.2 (preliminary findings milestone, month 9).

result.description: This final publication (special issue in peer-reviewed scientific journal) will present the main scientific outcomes of the project. It is targeted to the research community at EU and international levels. The publication is an outcome of Task 10.6.

result.title: Design elements and videos
result.description: Del 10.5 contains design elements for the EUCalc Pathways Explorer (and the educational tool), a ‚Äúwalkthrough of the application‚Äù- video and minimum 3 other animated movies that will inform the user about the most important sectors like energy, land-use, transport to show the social impacts and how they influence the different projections, benefits and pathways for a future Europe (pathway narrations). It will be available in various languages. Output of Task 10.3.

result.title: High-level event for launch of EUCalc Pathways Explorer
result.description: A launch event for the EUCalc Pathways Explorer with at least 80 participants will be organised in Brussels. The target group are EU-national (relevant governmental departments representatives) and European policy makers (DG-Res, DG-Clima, DG-Env, DG-Energy, DG-Agri, DG-Health) in charge for the implementation of the SET-Plan and other climate, energy, agriculture and health relevant policies. Output of Task 10.4.

result.title: Integration of the ‚ÄúTransboundary effects, trade & flows‚Äù module
result.description: Food, Energy, GHG emissions, materials, resources & economic impact flows are modelled between countries and with the rest of the world. The flows are consistent with the dynamics described in WP1 and the amounts described in the ‚ÄúEnergy & resources‚Äù section. The modules are clearly documented and correspond to the output of Task 8.6.

result.title: Integration of the resources modules ‚ÄúLand allocation, biodiversity impact & forestry‚Äù, ‚ÄúWater scarcity‚Äù and ‚Äúminerals‚Äù modules

result.title: Storage requirements Module
result.description: A refined time granularity is added to the energy system model. The needs for storage (from daily to long term), for electricity interconnections, and for demand side managements are estimated. The modules are clearly documented and correspond to the output of Task 8.5.

result.title: Documentation of the EUCalc GTAP version and Portfolio of GTAP outputs
result.description: "Detailed documentation of the specific version of the GTAP model and database developed for the EUCalc project; a library of GTAP results for a set of important, relevant and representative scenarios to be plugged into the EU Calculator including a sensitivity analysis. The selection of these representative scenarios are outlined in D7.2 and will be jointly finalized during the co-design process of WP7 with internal partners and external experts (Task 7.3). Once selected, these representative scenarios will be used to form an ""envelope"" to approximate the full range of the virtually unlimited user-defined decarbonization pathways. (Outputs from Task 7.4)"

result.title: "EUCalc ""European Pathways Explorer"": Achievements, Benefits and Model Simplifications"
result.description: A detailed policy brief, outlining i) which policy questions have been addressed by each models/modules, and who they were targeting, ii) a brief description of key modelling features, and iii) the level of transparency of the modelling exercise (assumptions, documentation, etc.). Coauthors are PIK and Imperial. It is related to Task 8.8

result.title: Integration of the ‚ÄúLifestyles‚Äù and ‚ÄúClimate‚Äù modules
result.description: The impact of the economy on lifestyle is modelled (including elasticity parameters). The impacts of Demography and climate on other elements of the model are assessed. Various scenarios describing the dynamics of the EU with the rest of the world are provided to WP7. The modules are clearly documented and correspond to the output of Task 8.3.

result.title: Defined threshold
result.description: Defined threshold, pre-warning threshold and opening value. One of the major and essential tasks in the condition-based and predictive maintenance project is the determination of the threshold of for the reference variables in which a maintenance task is required.
